text: Žilinėliai is a village in Jakėnai Eldership, Varėna District Municipality, Alytus County, in southeastern Lithuania. As of the 2011 census, the population was 20. == Geography == The village is located in southeastern Lithuania, in the northern part of Varėna District Municipality. It lies north of the town of Varėna, the seat of the municipality. Vilnius is to the northeast. Lake Netečius is to the north. == Demographics == As of the census of 2011, there were 20 people, of which 45% were male and 55% female. As of the census of 2001, there were 37 people, of which 48.6% were male and 51.4% female. == Transportation == The village lies along the (Vilnius–Varėna–Druskininkai–Grodno) highway, directly linking the settlement to Vilnius and Belarus. National road (Naujieji Valkininkai–Daugai–Alytus) also runs north of the village. == References == Category:Villages in Varėna District Municipality
title: Žilinėliai
